protocol_name: Dissociation of Nuclear Suspensions from Human Breast Tissues
protocol_name_html: Dissociation of Nuclear Suspensions from Human Breast Tissues
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"77p5n","text":"This protocol can be used to prepare nuclear suspensions from fresh or frozen tissue for single cell DNA or RNA sequencing experiments. For RNA analysis it is recommended to use fresh tissue samples, due to RNA degradation that occurs during freeze- thaw cycles, however for DNA analysis either frozen or fresh tissue can be used.  The protocol has been tested on breast tissues, and many frozen tumor tissues including breast, colon prostate and pancreatic samples.\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"235pr","text":"NST-DAPI: Mix 800 ml of NST solution (146 mM NaCl, 10 mM Tris base (pH 7.8), 1 mM CaCl2, 21 mM MgCl2, 0.05% (wt/vol) BSA and 0.2% (vol/vol) Nonidet P-40) with 200 ml of DAPI solution (106 mM MgCl2 and 10 mg of DAPI). Filter-sterilize the solution and store it at 4°C in the dark for up to 1 year. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":86,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":99,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":195,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cbs5","text":"Prepare chilled (4°C) Nuclei Wash and Resuspension Buffer: 1X PBS with 1.0% BSA and 0.2U/μl RNase Inhibitor.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euldo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"au36n","text":"Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmml0","text":"This protocol is for fresh or frozen tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"28rb7","text":"Cut fresh or frozen tissue (about 1x1x1cm) and mince it with a scalpel in a 10-cm Petri dish with   for  (10-15 min) until tissue chunks are no longer visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":98,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":104,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6gl7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eb0ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"af76i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"8413F620C29011E8914C310112474433","amount":"2","unit":2,"label":"NST-DAPI buffer","step_guid":"6ADBA9A0C29011E8914C310112474433"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"8AF68110C29011E8914C310112474433","duration":600,"label":"","step_guid":"6ADBA9A0C29011E8914C310112474433"}}],"guid":"6ADBA9A0C29011E8914C310112474433","id":668693,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Tissue preparation "}
